00092 #if !defined(DISABLE_SNMPV1) || !defined(DISABLE_SNMPV2C)
00093 /*******************************************************************-o-******
00094  * snmp_comstr_parse
00095  *
00096  * Parameters:
00097  *      *data           (I)   Message.
00098  *      *length         (I/O) Bytes left in message.
00099  *      *psid           (O)   Community string.
00100  *      *slen           (O)   Length of community string.
00101  *      *version        (O)   Message version.
00102  *      
00103  * Returns:
00104  *      Pointer to the remainder of data.
00105  *
00106  *
00107  * Parse the header of a community string-based message such as that found
00108  * in SNMPv1 and SNMPv2c.
00109  */
00110 u_char         *
00111 snmp_comstr_parse(u_char * data,
00112                   size_t * length,
00113                   u_char * psid, size_t * slen, long *version)
00114 {
00115     u_char          type;
00116     long            ver;
00117     size_t          origlen = *slen;
00118 
00119     /*
00120      * Message is an ASN.1 SEQUENCE.
00121      */
00122     data = asn_parse_sequence(data, length, &type,
00123                               (ASN_SEQUENCE | ASN_CONSTRUCTOR),
00124                               "auth message");
00125     if (data == NULL) {
00126         return NULL;
00127     }
00128 
00129     /*
00130      * First field is the version.
00131      */
00132     DEBUGDUMPHEADER("recv", "SNMP version");
00133     data = asn_parse_int(data, length, &type, &ver, sizeof(ver));
00134     DEBUGINDENTLESS();
00135     *version = ver;
00136     if (data == NULL) {
00137         ERROR_MSG("bad parse of version");
00138         return NULL;
00139     }
00140 
00141     /*
00142      * second field is the community string for SNMPv1 & SNMPv2c 
00143      */
00144     DEBUGDUMPHEADER("recv", "community string");
00145     data = asn_parse_string(data, length, &type, psid, slen);
00146     DEBUGINDENTLESS();
00147     if (data == NULL) {
00148         ERROR_MSG("bad parse of community");
00149         return NULL;
00150     }
00151     psid[SNMP_MIN(*slen, origlen - 1)] = '\0';
00152     return (u_char *) data;
00153 
00154 }                               /* end snmp_comstr_parse() */
00155 
00156 
00157 
00158 
00159 /*******************************************************************-o-******
00160  * snmp_comstr_build
00161  *
00162  * Parameters:
00163  *      *data
00164  *      *length
00165  *      *psid
00166  *      *slen
00167  *      *version
00168  *       messagelen
00169  *      
00170  * Returns:
00171  *      Pointer into 'data' after built section.
00172  *
00173  *
00174  * Build the header of a community string-based message such as that found
00175  * in SNMPv1 and SNMPv2c.
00176  *
00177  * NOTE:        The length of the message will have to be inserted later,
00178  *              if not known.
00179  *
00180  * NOTE:        Version is an 'int'.  (CMU had it as a long, but was passing
00181  *              in a *int.  Grrr.)  Assign version to verfix and pass in
00182  *              that to asn_build_int instead which expects a long.  -- WH
00183  */
00184 u_char         *
00185 snmp_comstr_build(u_char * data,
00186                   size_t * length,
00187                   u_char * psid,
00188                   size_t * slen, long *version, size_t messagelen)
00189 {
00190     long            verfix = *version;
00191     u_char         *h1 = data;
00192     u_char         *h1e;
00193     size_t          hlength = *length;
00194 
00195 
00196     /*
00197      * Build the the message wrapper (note length will be inserted later).
00198      */
00199     data =
00200         asn_build_sequence(data, length,
00201                            (u_char) (ASN_SEQUENCE | ASN_CONSTRUCTOR), 0);
00202     if (data == NULL) {
00203         return NULL;
00204     }
00205     h1e = data;
00206 
00207 
00208     /*
00209      * Store the version field.
00210      */
00211     data = asn_build_int(data, length,
00212                          (u_char) (ASN_UNIVERSAL | ASN_PRIMITIVE |
00213                                    ASN_INTEGER), &verfix, sizeof(verfix));
00214     if (data == NULL) {
00215         return NULL;
00216     }
00217 
00218 
00219     /*
00220      * Store the community string.
00221      */
00222     data = asn_build_string(data, length,
00223                             (u_char) (ASN_UNIVERSAL | ASN_PRIMITIVE |
00224                                       ASN_OCTET_STR), psid,
00225                             *(u_char *) slen);
00226     if (data == NULL) {
00227         return NULL;
00228     }
00229 
00230 
00231     /*
00232      * Insert length.
00233      */
00234     asn_build_sequence(h1, &hlength,
00235                        (u_char) (ASN_SEQUENCE | ASN_CONSTRUCTOR),
00236                        data - h1e + messagelen);
00237 
00238 
00239     return data;
00240 
00241 }                               /* end snmp_comstr_build() */
00242 #endif /* support for community based SNMP */
